borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The proposed double storey side and rear extension by reason of bulky appearance and unbalancing of the property constitute to an overdevelopment of the original dwellinghouse. Therefore, the proposed double storey side and rear extension is considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div>- Policies SP4, DM11 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy SP 2 of the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 1 of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation&nbsp;Version, September 2020).&nbsp;</span><br></div>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt;">The proposed porch&nbsp;by reason of its scale, height, and its poor alignment with the bay window feature, overly&nbsp;dominates the front elevations of the property. Therefore, the proposed porch consitutes a poor quality addition to the front elevations of the&nbsp;dwellinghouse, to the detriment of the wider street scene</span>.<span style="font-size:11pt">&nbsp;</span>As such, the proposed development is contrary to:<br></p><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);</div><div>- Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div>- Policies SP4, DM11 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).&nbsp;</div><div>-&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy SP 2 of the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 1 of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan,&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">Policy DMD 6&nbsp;of&nbsp;the Draft Local Plan&nbsp;</span><span style="font-size: 11pt;">(Regulation 19&nbsp;Consultation&nbsp;Version, September 2020).&nbsp;</span></div>
description: Construction of a two storey side extension, a part two storey part single storey rear extension and a front porch.
